metadata.feature_description: Analytics for wiki content including page edits, contributors, and content growth

steps.expected: Dashboard menu should expand showing Site Analytics and Community Analytics
steps.actual: Dashboard menu expanded with Site Analytics and Community Analytics options visible

steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard should load with tabs including Wiki
steps.actual: Dashboard panel remained blank/empty. JavaScript error occurred: TypeError: utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function at dashboardClass.init (social-dashboard-combined-instance.js:1025:39)

issues: Critical JavaScript error prevents Community Analytics dashboard from loading: TypeError: utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function
The error occurs in social-dashboard-combined-instance.js at line 1025 during dashboard initialization
The utility.serializeCustomDate function is called but not defined, causing the dashboard to fail silently

steps.action: Attempted to access Wiki tab in Community Analytics
steps.expected: Wiki tab should display page statistics
steps.actual: Could not access - Community Analytics dashboard failed to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Cannot test - Community Analytics dashboard is inaccessible due to initialization error

steps.actual: Could not access - Community Analytics dashboard failed to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Cannot test - Community Analytics dashboard is inaccessible due to initialization error

observations: Critical Bug: The Community Analytics dashboard fails to initialize due to a missing utility function (utility.serializeCustomDate)
The error occurs in the JavaScript file: social-dashboard-combined-instance.js at line 1025
This is a blocking bug that prevents access to all Community Analytics features including Wiki Module Analytics
The PersonaBar navigation to Dashboard > Community Analytics works correctly - the menu items are visible and clickable
The issue appears to be in the dashboard JavaScript initialization code, not in the navigation or API
Code review confirmed Wiki tab exists in resources (menu_Dashboard_Wiki.Text) and API endpoints exist for module analytics (GetModuleDashboardInfo, GetModulePopularContent, etc.)
All wiki analytics tests could not be executed because the parent Community Analytics dashboard is broken
